title: ClickTight Convertibles: Rear-Facing Lap Belt Installation with ClickTight
description:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in rear-facing mode using the vehicle lap belt and the ClickTight Installation System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in rear-facing mode using the vehicle lap belt and the ClickTight Installation System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.
For more information about Britax ClickTight convertible car seats, visit http://www.britaxusa.com/clicktight-convertibles

transcripts: Open the click tight by pressing the dimple on the click tight dial and rotating the dial clockwise until it releases and lift to open. Reclaim a child seat and place rear facing in the vehicle seat. Place a vehicle lap belt into the rear facing belts slot and sure the vehicle belt is not twisted and buckle the seat belt. Remove slack then close the click tight until a click is heard. The click tight level must be in the horizontal position and ensure that the ball in the reclined indicator is within the allowable blue section for the size of the child. If more recline is needed the seat can be reinstalled with a rolled towel or pool noodle under the front of the seat. Check that the child seat cannot be moved front to back. Or side to side more than one inch at the belt path. Rear facing installations can be improved by the use of the tether see the rear facing tethering segment.
